ECSchema.description: The BIS core schema contains classes that all other domain schemas extend.

ECCustomAttributeClass.description: Applied to an ECSchema to indicate that there is an associated JavaScript library that will provide run-time behavior.

ECArrayProperty.description: List of actions that are not permitted when the associated JavaScript library is not available.

ECCustomAttributeClass.description: Declare a list of properties as reserved. The property name listed would be forbidden from use in the class and classes that inherit from it.

ECArrayProperty.description: An array of names of properties that should not be used. Case-insensitive comparison will be used.

ECCustomAttributeClass.description: Applied to an ECClass to indicate that a C++ subclass of DgnDomain::Handler will supply behavior for it at run-time. This custom attribute may only be used by BisCore or other core schemas.

ECArrayProperty.description: List of actions that are not permitted when the associated handler is not available

ECEnumeration.description: Restrictions that may be applied to a CustomHandledProperty. Must match the ECSqlClassParams::StatementType enum

ECCustomAttributeClass.description: Applied to an element's property to indicate that the property's value is handled specially by a C++ class. Can only be applied to properties of ECClasses that specify ClassHasHandler.

ECProperty.description: Indicates the statement types that are relevant for a particular custom-handled property.

ECCustomAttributeClass.description: Applied to an element's property to indicate that select, update, and insert of the property's value are handled automatically by the platform.

ECProperty.description: Indicates the statement types that are relevant for a particular auto-handled property.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:CodeSpec (code specification) captures the rules for encoding and decoding significant business information into and from a Code (string). This specification is used to generate and validate Codes.

ECProperty.description: The unique name of the bis:CodeSpec. A best practice is to incorporate the schema alias or domain name into the bis:CodeSpec name to ensure uniqueness.
A JSON string containing scope and fragment specifications used to generate and validate code values

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Model is a container for persisting a collection of related elements.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The parent bis:Model contains the bis:Element that this bis:Model is sub-modeling.
The bis:Element that this bis:Model is sub-modeling. This bis:Model models the same Entity as the sub-Modeled bis:Element, but at a finer granularity.

ECProperty.description: If IsPrivate is true then this bis:Model should not appear in lists shown to the user.
If IsTemplate is true then this bis:Model is used as a template for creating new instances.
A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist ad hoc JSON values.
The last time any element in this Model was modified.

ECEntityClass.description: A container for persisting bis:GeometricElement instances.

ECProperty.description: A GUID that changes whenever any element in this GeometricModel has a change to its geometry.

ECEntityClass.description: A container for persisting bis:GeometricElement3d instances, which are considered to be in the iModel's real-world coordinate system unless their InSpatialIndex property has been set to 'false'.

ECProperty.description: If IsNotSpatiallyLocated is true, then the elements in this bis:GeometricModel3d are not in real-world coordinates and will not be in the spatial index.
If IsPlanProjection is true, then the elements in this bis:GeometricModel3d are expected to be in an XY plane.

ECEntityClass.description: A container for persisting bis:GeometricElement2d instances.

ECProperty.description: The actual coordinates of (0,0) in modeling coordinates. An offset applied to all modeling coordinates.

ECEntityClass.description: A container for persisting bis:GraphicalElement2d instances.
A container for persisting bis:GraphicalElement3d instances.

An abstract base class for bis:PhysicalModel and bis:SpatialLocationModel--the only two types of model for real physical space. Other GeometricModel3d specializations use the real-world coordinate system, but are considered as informational or mathematical abstractions.
A container for persisting bis:PhysicalElement and bis:SpatialLocationElement instances used to model real physical space. Also allows bis:GraphicalElement3d and bis:InformationContentElement.
A container for persisting bis:SpatialLocationElement instances. Also allows bis:GraphicalElement3d and bis:InformationContentElement.
A container for persisting bis:DrawingGraphic elements.

A container for persisting section bis:DrawingGraphic elements representing a cross-section of a PhysicalModel. Generally at the same scale as the sectioned geometry to allow it to be display in situ at the location of the sectioning.
A container for persisting sheet views and graphics.
A container for persisting bis:RoleElement instances. This class should be considered abstract, so the appropriate subclass of bis:RoleModel should be used instead.
A container for persisting bis:InformationContentElement instances.
A container for persisting bis:GroupInformationElement instances.
A container for persisting bis:InformationRecordElement instances
A container for persisting bis:DefinitionElement instances.

The singleton Model at the root of a BIS repository. Contains a hierarchy of bis:Subject elements that declare what the repository is modeling and child bis:InformationPartitionElement instances that establish Modeling Perspectives. Serves as a high-level table-of-contents for the BIS repository.
A container for persisting bis:Document elements.
A container for persisting bis:LinkElement instances.
The singleton container for repository-global bis:DefinitionElement instances.
DEPRECATED. Not used.

Deprecated.Description: Instances of WebMercatorModel are no longer created.

ECRelationshipClass.description: This relationship is essentially redundant with the combination of bis:ModelModelsElement and bis:ModelContainsElements. This 'shortcut' exists to support a model hierarchy index for performance reasons.
The relationship that enforces that each bis:Element belongs to exactly one bis:Model.

ECEntityClass.description: An interface that can be mixed-into a bis:Element to indicate that it can be sub-modeled by a finer-grained bis:Model. This interface is mutually exclusive with bis:IParentElement.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a bis:Model to the bis:Element that it sub-models. The sub-Model models the same Entity as the sub-modeled Element, but at a finer granularity.
Relates a bis:DefinitionModel to the bis:DefinitionPartition that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:DefinitionModel to the bis:DefinitionContainer that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:DrawingModel to the bis:TemplateRecipe2d that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:PhysicalModel to the bis:TemplateRecipe3d that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:SpatialLocationModel to the bis:TemplateRecipe3dInPlan that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:DocumentListModel to the bis:DocumentPartition that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:GroupInformationModel to the bis:GroupInformationPartition that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:InformationRecordModel to the bis:InformationRecordPartition that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:LinkModel to the bis:LinkPartition that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:PhysicalModel to the bis:PhysicalPartition that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:GraphicalModel3d to the bis:GraphicalPartition3d that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:SpatialLocationModel to the bis:SpatialLocationPartition that it sub-models.

Deprecated.Description: The PhysicalPortion class has been deprecated, so this relationship class is also deprecated.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a bis:DrawingModel to the bis:Drawing that it sub-models.
Relates a bis:Model to the bis:RepositoryLink that it sub-models.

ECEntityClass.description: Most abstract class and smallest individually identifiable building block for modeling Entities in a BIS repository.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:Model that contains this bis:Element.

ECProperty.description: The last modified time of the bis:Element. This is maintained by the core framework and should not be set directly by applications.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The CodeSpec property identifies the bis:CodeSpec used to generate and validate the code value for this bis:Element. The combination of CodeSpec, CodeScope, and CodeValue properties must be unique for each bis:Element instance.

The CodeScope property identifies the bis:Element that provides the uniqueness scope for the code value. The combination of CodeSpec, CodeScope, and CodeValue properties must be unique for each bis:Element instance.

ECProperty.description: Nullable string property that holds the actual text of an Element's Code. The combination of CodeSpec, CodeScope, and CodeValue properties must be unique for each bis:Element instance.
An optional friendly name given by the user (as opposed to the formal name stored in the CodeValue property).

ECNavigationProperty.description: The parent bis:Element that owns this bis:Element.

ECProperty.description: The GUID used to federate this bis:Element across repositories.
A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist ad hoc JSON values.

ECEntityClass.description: bis:InformationContentElement is an abstract base class for modeling pure information Entities. Only the core framework should directly subclass from bis:InformationContentElement. Domain and application developers should start with the most appropriate subclass of bis:InformationContentElement.
A bis:DriverBundleElement is used in conjunction with bis:ElementDrivesElement relationships to bundle multiple inputs before driving the output bis:Element.

bis:InformationRecordElement is an abstract base class for modeling information records. The bis:InformationRecordElement class is the default choice if no other subclass of bis:InformationContentElement makes sense.
A bis:DefinitionElement holds configuration-related information that is meant to be referenced/shared.

ECProperty.description: If true, this bis:DefinitionElement should not be displayed in the GUI.

ECEntityClass.description: This abstract class unifies DefinitionGroup and DefinitionContainer for relationship endpoint purposes.

ECProperty.description: The Rank of a DefinitionSet indicates how it was created, who is aware of it and where it can be used.

ECEntityClass.description: A set of DefinitionElements that are exclusively owned by the DefinitionContainer and contained within its sub-model.
A non-exclusive set of DefinitionElements grouped using the DefinitionGroupGroupsDefinitions relationship.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship used to identify the DefinitionsElements that are members of a DefinitionGroup.

ECEntityClass.description: Defines a shared set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a bis:Element.
Defines a shared set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a bis:GraphicalElement2d instance.

Defines a shared set of properties whose values vary per-type of a bis:PhysicalElement rather than per-instance. Intended for modeling Entities such as catalog entries, that typically define property values that are common among all instances associated with a given catalog entry.

ECNavigationProperty.description: Indicates the bis:PhysicalMaterial of which bis:PhysicalElements of the given bis:PhysicalType are made.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship indicating the bis:PhysicalMaterial of which bis:PhysicalElements of the given bis:PhysicalType are made. Can be overridden with bis:PhysicalElementIsOfPhysicalMaterial.

ECEntityClass.description: Defines a shared set of properties whose values vary per-type of a bis:SpatialLocationElement rather than per-instance.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a bis:SpatialLocationType to the bis:TypeDefinitionElement that it represents.
A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific bis:PhysicalElement is an instance of the defined bis:PhysicalType. E.g. a pump with serial number #AR-23 is of type X-Model-Y.
A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific bis:SpatialLocationElement is an instance of the defined bis:SpatialLocationType. E.g. AssemblyArea#5 if of type FloorSpace.

ECEntityClass.description: Defines instructions for creating/updating Element instances, e.g. determining their geometry from a template or a parametric script.
A recipe that uses a 2D template for creating new instances.
A recipe that uses a 3D template for creating new instances.
A recipe that uses a Plan-Projection template for creating new instances.

ECEnumeration.description: Supported MIME-type formats for Thumbnail images.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DefinitionElement that captures the Thumbnail of one or more bis:DefinitionElement instances.

ECProperty.description: Image of the Thumbnail.
Format of the Image captured as MIME-type.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship associating one or more instances of bis:DefinitionThumbnail with a particular bis:DefinitionElement.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Subject is an information element that references (by name) some real-world Object that will be modeled in this BIS repository.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of the real-world Object(s) that will be modeled for this Subject

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:InformationRecordElement that captures Project-level properties associated to the real-world Entity referenced by its parent Subject.

ECProperty.description: Name of the Project associated with the Parent Subject
Number of the Project associated with the Parent Subject
A human-readable description of the Location associated with the Parent Subject

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship allowing a bis:Subject to express association with another bis:Subject that is not one of its children.

ECEntityClass.description: An instance of a specialization of bis:InformationPartitionElement establishes a particular Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. Instances are always sub-modeled by a specialization of bis:Model of the appropriate Modeling Perspective.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable string describing the intent behind the partition.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DefinitionPartition element establishes a 'Definition' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:DefinitionPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:DefinitionModel.
A bis:DocumentPartition element establishes a 'Document' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:DocumentPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:DocumentListModel.

A bis:GroupInformationPartition element establishes a 'Group Information' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:GroupInformationPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:GroupInformationModel.

A bis:InformationRecordPartition element establishes a 'Information Record' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:InformationRecordPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:InformationRecordModel.
A bis:LinkPartition element establishes a 'Link' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:LinkPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:LinkModel.
A bis:PhysicalPartition element establishes a 'Physical' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:PhysicalPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:PhysicalModel.

A bis:SpatialLocationPartition element establishes a 'SpatialLocation' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:SpatialLocationPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:SpatialLocationModel.
A bis:GraphicalPartition3d element establishes a '3D Graphical' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:GraphicalPartition3d is always sub-modeled by a bis:GraphicalModel3d.
bis:InformationReferenceElement is an abstract base class used for modeling Entities whose main purpose is to reference something else.
bis:GroupInformationElement is an abstract base class used for modeling Entities whose main purpose is to group related elements.
A bis:LinkElement is a bis:InformationReferenceElement that specifies a link to some resource that is not modeled with BIS.
A bis:UrlLink is a bis:LinkElement that specifies a URL link.

ECProperty.description: A URL pointing to an external resource.
A human-readable description of the URL

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:RepositoryLink is a bis:UrlLink element that links to an external repository. It implements ISubModeledElement only so that a sub-Model could be used to cache information from the external repository.

ECProperty.description: A GUID that identifies the external repository.
The format of the external repository.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ElementUniqueAspect that is used to capture metadata about its owning bis:RepositoryLink.

ECProperty.description: Name and optionally version of the software application or tool that created data in the External DataSource referenced through the owning RepositoryLink

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:EmbeddedFileLink is a bis:LinkElement that links to a file embedded within the iModel.

ECProperty.description: A name for looking up the embedded file. Must be unique within the iModel.
A human-readable description of the Embedded File

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Document is a social artifact designed with the distinct purpose to convey information in a manner that maximizes reach and lifespan and minimize dependency on other artifacts. Although there is often a one-to-one relationship between a bis:Document and an electronic file, this does not imply that a document is a file; instead, a document can be realized in many different media (such as paper) or have more than one file supporting it.
A bis:Drawing is a bis:Document of a 2D drawing.

ECProperty.description: Scale factor to be applied to any GeometricElement2d containing Text in its GeometryStream, during its creation in the associated DrawingModel, and later used when attaching this Drawing to a Sheet.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:SectionDrawing is a bis:Drawing of a 2D section of a spatial view. A bis:SectionDrawing can be sub-modeled by a DrawingModel or a GraphicalModel3d.

ECProperty.description: Type of the section: e.g. Section, Plan, Elevation, Detail.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The SpatialViewDefinition used to generate this SectionDrawing.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Identifies the SpatialViewDefinition used to generate the SectionDrawing.

ECProperty.description: Height of the sheet border.
Width of the sheet border.
Height of the sheet.
Width of the sheet.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Sheet is a bis:Document of a 2D sheet.

ECProperty.description: The Sheet's drawing scale
Height of the Sheet (in meters)
Width of the Sheet (in meters)

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:SheetIndexPartition element establishes a 'Sheet Index' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:SheetIndexPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:SheetIndexModel.
A container for persisting bis:SheetIndexEntry and bis:SheetIndex elements.
A bis:InformationReferenceElement used as the base-class for elements that participate in a Sheet-Index hierarchy.

ECProperty.description: Can be used to prioritize or order members within a SheetIndex or SheetIndexFolder.

ECEntityClass.description: A SheetIndexEntry used to organize other SheetIndexEntry instances in a hierarchy.
A SheetIndexEntry used to include a Sheet instance into a Sheet-Index hierarchy.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:Sheet that this bis:SheetReference is ponting to.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ElementUniqueAspect that captures common information about a single Sheet that is typically included in its graphical layout.
A bis:InformationReferenceElement used to organize bis:Sheet instances into a hierarchy with the assistance of bis:SheetIndexFolder and other bis:SheetIndex instances.
A SheetIndexEntry used to include a SheetIndex hierarchy into another one.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:SheetIndex that this bis:SheetIndexReference is ponting to.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: An Information Carrier carries information, but is not the information itself. For example, the arrangement of ink on paper or the sequence of electronic bits are information carriers.

Deprecated.Description: BisCore will focus on the information itself and not how it is carried. Thus, the InformationCarrierElement class was deprecated.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: A Document Carrier is an Information Carrier that carries a Document. An electronic file is a good example.

Deprecated.Description: BisCore will focus on the information itself and not how it is carried. Thus, the DocumentCarrier class was deprecated.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Element and abstract base class used to model Entities that intrinsically have geometry.
bis:GeometricElement3d is an abstract base class used to model real world Entities that intrinsically have 3D geometry.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:SpatialCategory used to categorize this bis:GeometricElement3d

ECProperty.description: If true, this element will have an entry in the Spatial Index.
The placement origin of this bis:Element.
The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this bis:Element.
The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this bis:Element.
The Roll angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this bis:Element.
The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this bis:Element.

ECNavigationProperty.description: Points to an instance of some specialization of TypeDefinition, which holds property values that vary per-type rather than per-instance of this Element.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:GraphicalElement3d element conveys information within 3D graphical presentations.
A bis:SpatialElement is a bis:GeometricElement3d that occupies real world space.
A bis:PhysicalElement is spatially located, has mass, and can be 'touched'.

ECNavigationProperty.description: Indicates the bis:PhysicalMaterial of which the bis:PhysicalElement is made.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship indicating the bis:PhysicalMaterial of which the bis:PhysicalElement is made.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: A Physical Portion represents an arbitrary portion of a larger Physical Element that will be sub-modeled by a Physical Model.

Deprecated.Description: The best practice is now to inherit from a PhysicalElement subclass and mix-in ISubModeledElement directly.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:SpatialLocationElement identifies a 'tracked' real world location but has no mass and cannot be 'touched'.
DEPRECATED: A Spatial Location Portion represents an arbitrary portion of a larger Spatial Location Element that will be sub-modeled by a Spatial Location Model.

Deprecated.Description: The best practice is now to inherit from a SpatialLocationElement subclass and mix-in ISubModeledElement directly.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:VolumeElement is a bis:SpatialLocationElement that is restricted to defining a volume.
bis:GeometricElement2d is an abstract base class used to model information Entities that intrinsically have 2D geometry.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:DrawingCategory used to categorize this bis:GeometricElement2d instance.

ECProperty.description: The placement origin of this bis:Element.
The placement rotation (in degrees) of this bis:Element.
The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this bis:Element.

ECNavigationProperty.description: Points to an instance of some specialization of TypeDefinition, which holds property values that vary per-type rather than by instance of this Element.

ECEntityClass.description: bis:GraphicalElement2d is an abstract base class for 2D geometric elements that are used to convey information within graphical presentations (like drawings).
bis:AnnotationElement2d is a bis:GraphicalElement2d used to annotate drawings and sheets.
bis:DrawingGraphic is a bis:GraphicalElement2d used to persist graphics for use in drawings.
The aspect used to store text annotation data for bis:TextAnnotation2d an bis:TextAnnotation3d elements.

Deprecated.Description: `TextAnnotationData` is deprecated and replaced by the `TextAnnotationData` property of TextAnnotation2d and TextAnnotation3d classes.

ECProperty.description: Text in Annotations.fb.h flat buffer format

ECEntityClass.description: An interface that can be mixed-into a bis:GeometricElement-subclass to indicate that its GeometryStream contains structured text-content that is styled according to a referenced AnnotationTextStyle, and optionally, contains portions of text-content computed from property-values in other Elements (aka Text-Fields)

ECNavigationProperty.description: The default text style used by the ITextAnnotation.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship indicating that the source ITextAnnotation instance uses the target AnnotationTextStyle instance by default.
A relationship indicating that the source Element instance drives a portion of the text-content of the target ITextAnnotation instance.

ECProperty.description: Data used to generate the visual representation of a TextAnnotation2d element.

Deprecated.Description: See deprecation description for TextAnnotationData class.

ECProperty.description: Data used to generate the visual representation of a TextAnnotation3d element.

Deprecated.Description: See deprecation description for TextAnnotationData class.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:AnnotationElement2d that displays a geometric measurement on a drawing or sheet.

ECProperty.description: A string property that that stores a complete description of the dimension in json format.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The dimension style used by the DimensionAnnotation2d.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship indicating that the source DimensionAnnotation2d instance uses the target AnnotationDimensionStyle instance.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DimensionAnnotation2d that displays a linear distance measurement.
A bis:DimensionAnnotation2d that displays an angular measurement.
A bis:DimensionAnnotation2d that displays the measurement of the radius or diameter of an arc.
A bis:DimensionAnnotation2d that displays a set of linear distance measurements from a common datum.
A bis:AnnotationElement2d that displays a tabular grid of information.

ECProperty.description: A string property that stores a complete description of the table in json format.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The view that is to be attached

ECEntityClass.description: An interface that can be mixed-into a bis:Element to indicate that it can be a parent (own child Elements). This interface is mutually exclusive with bis:ISubModeledElement.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a bis:Element to child bis:Elements which represent parts of the Entity modeled by the parent bis:Element.
A relationship that indicates that child bis:Elements are meant to be hidden.
A relationship that indicates a physical assembly of child bis:PhysicalElements.
A relationship used to identify the bis:PhysicalType instances that are sub-parts to compose a larger bis:PhysicalType.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ElementAspect is a class that defines a set of properties that are related to (and owned by) a single bis:Element. Semantically, a bis:ElementAspect can be considered part of the bis:Element. Thus, a bis:ElementAspect is deleted if its owning bis:Element is deleted.
A bis:ElementUniqueAspect is a bis:ElementAspect where there can be only zero or one instance of the bis:ElementAspect class per bis:Element.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:Element that owns this bis:ElementUniqueAspect

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ElementMultiAspect is a bis:ElementAspect where there can be N instances of the bis:ElementAspect class per bis:Element.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:Element that owns this bis:ElementMultiAspect.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ElementMultiAspect that stores synchronization information for a bis:Element originating from an external source.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The Id of a bis:Element that represents a scope in which the combination of properties 'Kind' and 'Identifier' will be unique. Used differently by different iModel Connectors. Recommended to point to a RepositoryLink when ids are unique per repository.

ECProperty.description: The identifier of the object in the source repository
The kind of object within the source repository

An optional value that is typically a version number or a pseudo version number like last modified time. It will be used by the synchronization process to detect that a source object is unchanged so that computing a cryptographic hash can be avoided. If present, this value must be guaranteed to change when any of the source object's content changes.
The cryptographic hash (any algorithm) of the source object's content. If defined, it must be guaranteed to change when the source object's content changes.
A place where additional JSON properties can be stored. For example, provenance information or properties relating to the synchronization process.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The external source from which this element originated.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Used by ECNavigationProperty bis:ExternalSourceAspect.Scope
Relates an Element (via its ExternalSourceAspect) with its ExternalSource. Used as an ECNavigationProperty by bis:ExternalSourceAspect.Source.

ECEntityClass.description: An ExternalSource refers to an 'information container' found in a repository. In some cases, the container is the entire repository.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The repository in which this 'information container' is stored.

ECProperty.description: Name of the iModel Connecter that processed this ExternalSource.
Version of the iModel Connecter that processed this ExternalSource.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Used by ExternalSource.Repository ECNavigationProperty
Relationship between an external source and its attachments

ECEntityClass.description: Attachment of an ExternalSource

ECNavigationProperty.description: The ExternalSource that is attached by this ExternalSourceAttachment

ECProperty.description: If Role=SpecifyContext, the attached ExternalSource provides context. If Role=SpecifyPart, the attached ExternalSource models a part of the whole.
The translation or offset in global coordinates of the attached ExternalSource relative to the ExternalSource that attaches it.
The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the attached ExternalSource relative to the ExternalSource that attaches it.
The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the attached ExternalSource relative to the ExternalSource that attaches it.
The Roll angle (in degrees) of the attached ExternalSource relative to the ExternalSource that attaches it.
The scale of the attached ExternalSource relative to the ExternalSource that attaches it.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Used by ECNavigationProperty bis:ExternalSourceAttachment.Attaches

ECEnumeration.description: The role that an attached ExternalSource plays, e.g. to specify context or a part-of-a-whole. Used by bis:ExternalSource.Role

ECEntityClass.description: A group of ExternalSources that are collectively a source of information for one or more elements.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Groups ExternalSources that collectively act as a source used by an ExternalSourceAspect.

ECEntityClass.description: Link to the Configuration for an iModel Synchronization Job

ECProperty.description: Date/Time of Last Successful Run of this Synchronization Configuration

Deprecated.Description: The LastSuccessfulRun property is deprecated and no longer expected to be written as part of SynchronizationConfigLink instances.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Records the ExternalSources processed according to a given configuration. These sources may be 'discovered' via the 'root' sources specified by bis:SynchronizationConfigSpecifiesRootSources. ExternalSources can be processed by more than one SynchronizationConfig.
Records the 'root' ExternalSources specified by the configuration. These roots are used to discovered other 'referenced' sources and they serve as roots of 'referencing trees' for GUI display.

ECEntityClass.description: Represents a folder-like structure that organizes repositories (typically files) in an external system

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relationship between a Folder and the sub-Folders which it contains
Relationship between a Folder and the Repositories which it contains

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ElementUniqueAspect that identifies a bis:Element as one of the roots of a *channel*, specified by its *channel-key*, which is a subset of the overall model-hierarchy and associated data, that is independently maintained.

ECProperty.description: Channel-key of the channel
Semantic version of the data-organization and default content in the channel, set by the Owner that last edited it.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A general relationship between two bis:Elements. These are typically specialized by derived relationship to give more specific meaning.

ECProperty.description: Can be used to prioritize or order elements being referenced. Values do not have to be unique for a particular referencing element.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A general relationship between a bis:Element and a bis:Document. There is no implied owner in this relationship so it is valid for relationship where the document existed before the referenced element (e.g. design specification) or after (e.g. operational results).
Represents group membership. Relates a group Element to its member Elements.

Represents group membership where the group Element (and its properties) impart information about the member Elements above mere membership. Implies that properties of the group should be considered as properties of its members.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:PhysicalSystemPartition element establishes a 'Physical System' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:PhysicalSystemPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:PhysicalSystemModel.
A container for persisting bis:PhysicalSystem elements.
A collection of connected `SpatialElements` (primarily `PhysicalElements`) that collectively implement some function.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The aggregator of this sub-system within the System hierarchy.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Forms the Physical System hierarchy.
A relationship used to identify the bis:PhysicalElements that are members of a PhysicalSystem.
A relationship used to identify the bis:SpatialElements serviced by a PhysicalSystem.
A relationship that indicates that the source Element drives (controls the lifecycle or structure of) a dependent target Element.

ECProperty.description: Bits that indicate the status of the dependency. Satisfied=0, Failed=1, Deferred=128. Deferred and Failed bits can be OR-ed together.
The priority of this dependency, relative to other ElementDrivesElement instances. Note that ElementOwnsChildElements dependencies always take priority over ElementDrivesElement dependencies.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Category categorizes a bis:GeometricElement and its geometry. Every bis:GeometricElement is in one and only one bis:Category. The visibility (on/off) of a bis:Category may be controlled per-view. Categories are similar to levels in DGN, layers in DWG, and categories in RVT.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of the Category
The Rank of a category indicates how it was created, who is aware of it and where it can be used.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DrawingCategory is used for classifying bis:GeometricElement2d elements via the bis:GeometricElement2dIsInCategory (concrete and sealed) relationship.
A bis:SpatialCategory is used for classifying bis:GeometricElement3d elements via the bis:GeometricElement3dIsInCategory (concrete and sealed) relationship.

A bis:SubCategory is a subdivision of a bis:Category. SubCategories allow GeometricElements to have multiple pieces of Geometry that can be independently visible and styled (color, linesStyle, transparency, etc.). It is important to understand that a bis:SubCategory is not a bis:Category (i.e. Categories do not nest). bis:GeometricElements are always related to a bis:Category, not a bis:SubCategory.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of the SubCategory
Contains the display properties (color, style, weight, etc.) for the SubCategory. It should not be used for the persistence of application-specific information.
The Rank of a SubCategory indicates how it was created, who is aware of it and where it can be used.

ECRelationshipClass.description: The relationship that determines the bis:DrawingCategory for a bis:GeometricElement2d.
The relationship that determines the bis:SpatialCategory for a bis:GeometricElement3d.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of the ColorBook

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:RenderMaterial defines the rendering properties of materials for display. Not to be confused with a bis:PhysicalMaterial.

ECProperty.description: The palette name that categorizes this RenderMaterial.
A human-readable description of the RenderMaterial

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:PhysicalMaterial defines the matter of which physical objects are made. bis:PhysicalMaterials are not used to define rendering characteristics (see bis:RenderMaterial).

ECNavigationProperty.description: Optionally refers to the bis:RenderMaterial to be used to display the bis:PhysicalMaterial.

ECRelationshipClass.description: The relationship that determines the bis:RenderMaterial to use while displaying a bis:PhysicalMaterial.

ECProperty.description: Description of the style
Settings of the style
Encoded style properties

Deprecated.Description: The `Data` property is deprecated and replaced by the `Settings` property.

ECProperty.description: Description of the style
Encoded style properties
Description of the style
Encoded style properties
Description of the style
Encoded style properties

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DefinitionElement that defines the appearance of a bis:DimensionAnnotation2d.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The bis:AnnotationTextStyle used by the bis:AnnotationDimensionStyle.

ECProperty.description: Settings of the style
Description of the style

ECRelationshipClass.description: A relationship indicating that the source AnnotationDimensionStyle instance uses the target AnnotationTextStyle instance.

ECProperty.description: Description of the style
Encoded style properties

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Texture represents a named texture used for rendering purposes. The texture data is stored as a binary blob interpreted according to the specified texture format.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of the Texture
Encoded texture data
Format of the encoded texture data.
Image width in pixels.
Image height in pixels.
Currently unused and always zero.

ECEntityClass.description: The spatial location of a light source

ECProperty.description: Indicates that the light is on.

ECEntityClass.description: The spatial location of a section drawing generated from a SpatialViewDefinition.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The section view generated from the SpatialViewDefinition.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a SectionDrawingLocation to the view generated by the section's SpatialViewDefinition.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: The section location defines how a section drawing should be generated in a 3d view.

Deprecated.Description: The SectionLocation class is deprecated and is replaced by SectionDrawingLocation.

ECProperty.description: Type of the section: e.g. Section, Plan, Elevation, Detail.
Details on how this section was clipped.

ECNavigationProperty.description: Describes the models relevant for this section location display.
Describes the categories relevant for this section location display.

ECNavigationProperty.displayLabel: Describes the view attachment attached to this section location

ECRelationshipClass.description: DEPRECATED: Relates a SectionLocation to the models relevant for this SectionLocation display.

Deprecated.Description: The SectionLocation class and associated relationships are deprecated and are replaced by SectionDrawingLocation.

ECRelationshipClass.description: DEPRECATED: Relates a SectionLocation to the categories relevant for this SectionLocation display.

Deprecated.Description: The SectionLocation class and associated relationships are deprecated and are replaced by SectionDrawingLocation.

ECRelationshipClass.description: DEPRECATED: Relates a SectionLocation to a ViewAttachment placing the section's DrawingViewDefinition onto a Sheet.

Deprecated.Description: The SectionLocation class and associated relationships are deprecated and are replaced by SectionDrawingLocation.

ECRelationshipClass.description: DEPRECATED: Use ElementHasLinks

ECEntityClass.description: Specifies the list of 3d models displayed by a SpatialViewDefinition. Multiple SpatialViewDefinitions may point to the same ModelSelector.
Specifies the list of categories displayed by a ViewDefinition. Multiple ViewDefinitions may point to the same CategorySelector.

A bis:DisplayStyle defines the 'styling' parameters for rendering the contents of a view. It determines how graphics are rendered, not which elements are rendered. A bis:DisplayStyle can be shared by many Views.
A bis:DisplayStyle2d defines the 'styling' parameters for rendering the contents of a 2D View.
A bis:DisplayStyle3d defines the 'styling' parameters for rendering the contents of a 3D View.
Timeline information for rendering and visualizing animations and schedule simulations.

ECProperty.description: An optional, human-readable description of the Render Timeline
A JSON string containing the timeline and rendering instructions

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ViewDefinition specifies the area/volume that is viewed, and refers to a bis:DisplayStyle and a bis:CategorySelector to be used. Subclasses of bis:ViewDefinition determine which model(s) are viewed.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of the View Definition

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:ViewDefinition3d specifies the volume that is viewed on referenced 3D bis:Models. It refers to a bis:DisplayStyle3d and a bis:CategorySelector to be used.

ECProperty.description: Origin of the viewed volume on the lower, back, rear
Size of the view diagonal
Yaw component of the view direction in degrees
Pitch component of the view direction in degrees
Roll component of the view direction in degrees
Is the camera actually turned on?
Camera eye point
Camera lens angle in degrees
Camera focus distance

ECEntityClass.description: A view of a spatially located volume.
A spatial view that always shows a parallel projection.
A view of a 2D model that has its own local coordinate system.

ECProperty.description: Lower left corner of the viewed area.
Size of the view diagonal
Rotation angle in degrees of the viewed area.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DrawingViewDefinition specifies parameters for a view of a bis:DrawingModel.
A bis:SheetViewDefinition specifies parameters for a view of a bis:SheetModel.
A bis:ViewDefinition2d used to display a 2D template model.
A bis:ViewDefinition3d used to display a 3D template model.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Associates bis:LinkElements to a bis:Element.

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:Element and abstract base class used to model roles assumed by an Entity that is not intrinsic to the Entity playing the role.
The Spatial Index contains information used to optimize spatial queries. Like other database indices, it is automatically maintained by the system.

ECProperty.description: Minimum X value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
Maximum X value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
Minimum Y value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
Maximum Y value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
Minimum Z value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
Maximum Z value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element

ECEntityClass.description: A bis:DefinitionElement that specifies a collection of geometry that is meant to be reused across bis:GeometricElement instances. Leveraging bis:GeometryParts can help reduce file size and improve display performance.

ECProperty.description: The actual geometry of the Geometry Part
The low corner of the Geometry Part's bounding box.
The high corner of the Geometry Part's bounding box

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a bis:DrawingGraphic to the bis:Element that it represents.
Relates a bis:GraphicalElement3d to the bis:Element that it represents.
Relates a bis:SpatialLocationElement to the bis:Element that it represents.

ECProperty.description: See the ACSType enum. None = 0; Rectangular = 1; Cylindrical = 2; Spherical = 3.
A human-readable description of the Auxiliary Coordinate System

ECEntityClass.description: A 2D coordinate system.

ECProperty.description: Defines the real location of the 0, 0 coordinate of the ACS.
The angle (in degrees) of the Coordinate System

ECEntityClass.description: A 3D coordinate system.

ECProperty.description: Defines the plane of the ACS and the real location of the 0, 0, 0 coordinate of the ACS.
The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this Coordinate System
The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this Coordinate System
The Roll angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this Coordinate System

ECEntityClass.description: A spatial coordinate system.
